availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Parker (Henderson County and Webster County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Henderson County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Son of Ruth Parker. Married to Sarah F. Parker. Resident of Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860. Household owned an additional eight enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 337A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 560.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 546.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 432A.
"John H. Parker (1836-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #108684269, accessed December 9, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108684269.
